DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text that describes the deletion abnormality for the proximal (short) arm of chromosome 1 and the distal (long) arm of chromosome 19.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Proximal (short) arm of chromosome 1_An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Distal (long) arm of chromosome 19_One of the bodies (normally 46 in humans) in the cell nucleus that is the bearer of genes, has the form of a delicate chromatin filament during interphase, contracts to form a compact cylinder segmented into two arms by the centromere during metaphase and anaphase stages of cell division, and is capable of reproducing its physical and chemical structure through successive cell divisions. In microbes, the chromosome is prokaryotic, not being enclosed within a nuclear membrane and not being subject to a mitotic mechanism._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Proximal (short) arm of chromosome 1:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Distal (long) arm of chromosome 19:One of the bodies (normally 46 in humans) in the cell nucleus that is the bearer of genes, has the form of a delicate chromatin filament during interphase, contracts to form a compact cylinder segmented into two arms by the centromere during metaphase and anaphase stages of cell division, and is capable of reproducing its physical and chemical structure through successive cell divisions. In microbes, the chromosome is prokaryotic, not being enclosed within a nuclear membrane and not being subject to a mitotic mechanism.

Concepts.definition: Proximal (short) arm of chromosome 1
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Distal (long) arm of chromosome 19
A structure found in cells that is comprised of a strand of linearized double-stranded DNA plus proteins that package the DNA in a condensed coil form and regulate chromosomal function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Loss of Chromosome 19q And Loss of Chromosome 1p

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Loss of Chromosome 19q And Loss of Chromosome 1p
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the allelic loss of the chromosomal arm 19q.  It has been described in gliomas and hemangiopericytomas.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the allelic loss of the chromosomal arm 1p.  It has been described in gliomas, meningiomas, neuroblastomas, hepatocellular carcinomas, breast carcinomas, acinar prostate adenocarcinomas, pancreatic carcinomas, and adrenal gland adenomas.

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the loss of all or part of the long arm of chromosome 19 (19q). It has been described in gliomas and hemangiopericytomas.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the loss of all or part of the short arm of chromosome 1 (1p). It has been described in gliomas, meningiomas, neuroblastomas, hepatocellular carcinomas, breast carcinomas, acinar prostate adenocarcinomas, pancreatic carcinomas, and adrenal gland adenomas.
